description: Mobile techniques used by Agent Smith, ATT&CK software S0440 (v1.0)
name: Agent Smith (S0440)

techniques.comment: [Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) can inject fraudulent ad modules into existing applications on a device.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)

[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) exploits known OS vulnerabilities, including Janus, to replace legitimate applications with malicious versions.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)
[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) shows fraudulent ads to generate revenue.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)
[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) can hide its icon from the application launcher.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)
[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) deletes infected applications’ update packages when they are detected on the system, preventing updates.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)

[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) can impersonate any popular application on an infected device, and the core malware disguises itself as a legitimate Google application. [Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440)'s dropper is a weaponized legitimate Feng Shui Bundle.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)
[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440)’s core malware is disguised as a JPG file, and encrypted with an XOR cipher.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)
[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) checks if a targeted application is running in user-space prior to infection.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)
[Agent Smith](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0440) obtains the device’s application list.(Citation: CheckPoint Agent Smith)
